BattleLogInOut_0.schema:
CREATE TABLE `BattleLogInOut_0` (
	`GameSvrId` varchar(32),
	`dtEventTime` datetime COMMENT 'Event timestamp, records the time the event occurred',
	`iZoneAreaID` int(11) COMMENT 'Zone Area ID, identifies the in-game zone or area',
	`RoleID` varchar(64) COMMENT 'Role ID, uniquely identifies the player's role',
	`BattleSrvId` varchar(32) COMMENT 'Battle server ID, identifies the server where the battle takes place',
	`Map` varchar(64) COMMENT 'Map, identifies the in-game map id',
	`team_number` smallint(6) COMMENT 'Team number, represents the number of players in the team',
	`location` varchar(64) COMMENT 'Location, represents the player's coordinates in the game',
	`BattleTeamId` varchar(32) COMMENT 'Battle team ID, the ID corresponding to the team the player is in. Returns 0 if no team',
	`BattleLoginTime` varchar(64) COMMENT 'Battle login time, the time the player logged into the battle',
	`BattleLogoutTime` varchar(64) COMMENT 'Battle logout time, the time the player logged out of the battle',
	`BattleLogDuration` int(11) COMMENT 'Battle log duration, records the duration from login to logout in the battle'
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;
BattleLogInOut_0.example:
/*
3 rows from BattleLogInOut_0 table:
GameSvrId	dtEventTime	iZoneAreaID	RoleID	BattleSrvId	Map	team_number	location	BattleTeamId	BattleLoginTime	BattleLogoutTime	BattleLogDuration
*/

BattleItem_0.schema:
CREATE TABLE `BattleItem_0` (
	`dtEventTime` datetime COMMENT 'Event timestamp, records the time the event occurred',
	`RoleID` varchar(64) COMMENT 'Role ID, uniquely identifies the player's role',
	`BattleSrvId` varchar(32) COMMENT 'Battle server ID, identifies the server where the battle takes place',
	`BattleTeamId` varchar(32) COMMENT 'Battle team ID, the ID corresponding to the team the player is in. Returns 0 if no team',
	`BattleItemId` int(11) COMMENT 'item unique id',
	`BattleItemPosition` varchar(32),
	`BattleItemChangeType` varchar(32),
	`BattleItemChangeSource` varchar(32) COMMENT 'indicate the source of item change in string',
	`BattleItemChangeSourceId` varchar(64) COMMENT 'the entity template id of source type',
	`BattleItemDelta` int(11) COMMENT 'the numbers of item change',
	`BattleItemBefore` int(11),
	`BattleItemAfter` int(11)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;
BattleItem_0.example:
/*
3 rows from BattleItem_0 table:
dtEventTime	BattleSrvId	RoleID	BattleTeamId	BattleItemId	BattleItemPosition	BattleItemChangeType	BattleItemChangeSource	BattleItemChangeSourceId	BattleItemDelta	BattleItemBefore	BattleItemAfter
*/

Gather_0.schema:
CREATE TABLE `Gather_0` (
	`dtEventTime` datetime COMMENT 'time when gather event',
	`RoleID` varchar(64),
	`BattleSrvId` varchar(32) COMMENT 'Battle server ID, identifies the server where the battle takes place',
	`location` varchar(64),
	`GatherItem` bigint(20) COMMENT 'id of item',
	`GatherItemNumber` bigint(20),
	`GatherSource` varchar(32),
	`GatherTool` int(11)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;
Gather_0.example:
/*
3 rows from Gather_0 table:
dtEventTime	BattleSrvId	RoleID	location	GatherItem	GatherItemNumber	GatherSource	GatherTool
*/

/*
3 rows from PlayerLogin_0 table:
dtEventTime	RoleID	RoleName
*/
